name: dock-tinker
title: Dock Tinker
description:
Custom hidden preferences of Dock.
Backup, restore and reset Dock state.
author: koinzhang

commands.name: add-spacer-to-dock
commands.title: Add Spacer to Dock
commands.subtitle: Dock
commands.description: Add a movable spacer tile between icons on the Dock.

commands.name: restore-dock-state
commands.title: Restore Dock State
commands.subtitle: Dock
commands.description: Restore Dock state from the last backups.

commands.name: toggle-auto-hide
commands.title: Toggle Auto Hide
commands.subtitle: Dock
commands.description: The Dock will automatically show and hide.

commands.name: toggle-dock-orientation
commands.title: Toggle Dock Orientation
commands.subtitle: Dock
commands.description: Set the orientation of the Dock, including Left, Bottom, Right

commands.name: toggle-minimal-effect
commands.title: Toggle Minimal Effect
commands.subtitle: Dock
commands.description: Set the effects when the application is minimized, including Suck, Genie, Scale.

commands.name: toggle-scroll-to-open
commands.title: Toggle Scroll to Open
commands.subtitle: Dock
commands.description: Allows you to use the scroll up gesture to open the stack or use the same gesture on a running application to display all windows associated with that application (also known as Expos√©).

commands.name: toggle-show-hidden
commands.title: Toggle Show Hidden
commands.subtitle: Dock
commands.description: The icon of apps with hidden window on the Dock will be dimmed.

commands.name: toggle-single-app
commands.title: Toggle Single App
commands.subtitle: Dock
commands.description: When you click on an app on the Dock, the window of that app will be displayed at the top and all other apps will be hidden at the same time.

commands.name: toggle-static-only
commands.title: Toggle Static Only
commands.subtitle: Dock
commands.description: The Dock will only show the icon of the currently running application.
